answers.text:
Hello Nancy,
The Knowledge Network has a vast collection of resources on Succession Planning.  
One place to start is with this document from the Office of the Inspector General of the U.S.  It evaluates the succession plan of the FDIC on the basis of 7 criteria.  These criteria can help guide your community in creating its own succession plan:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301888/Evaluation_of_the_FDICs_Succession_Planning_Efforts
This article from the Texas Municipal League examines how Colleyville, TX created a succession strategy with large numbers of employees anticipating retirement:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1631/Succession_Planning_The_Time_Has_Arrived
These are 39 best practices for current public managers to prepare future public managers, from ICMA's own Public Management publication:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4557/39_Best_Practices_for_Preparing_the_Next_Generation
For a more action-oriented approach, this guide from Public Management outlines nine tasks to select and train potential talent:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5517/Creating_a_Leadership_Development_Program
ICMA Members have access to documents such as this award-nominated program from Schaumburg, IL.  It describes Schaumburg's succession program in detail:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304293/Succession_Planning
This is Santa Barbara's Succession Program, outlined as six strategies:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9050/City_of_Santa_Barbara_CA_Succession_Program
And finally, three example succession plans from Modest, Dallas, and Fairfax:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302033/Succession_Planning
For National Mentoring Month the Knowledge Network's blog posted about mentoring the next generation of managers.  A collection of various resources are contained in the post:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blogpost/982/National_Mentoring_Month
You can find more resources in the documents and topics section; you might find the Next Generation of Managers topic especially helpful:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/179/Next_Generation_of_Managers
I hope these helped!
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA
